description: Medical care decisions for treating injuries and illnesses through the camp surgeon or folk remedies

events.title: Seek the Surgeon
events.setup:
The surgeon's tent sits apart from the others, marked by the smell of herbs and the moans of the wounded. You've seen him work before — steady hands, no wasted motion. His fees are fair, and his patients usually walk away.

Usually.

options.resultText: He examines you with clinical efficiency. "Nasty, but I've seen worse." The needle bites, the poultice stings, but when he's done, you feel the weight lift. "Rest. Don't do anything stupid." Sound advice from a man who's patched up too many soldiers who didn't listen.
options.resultTextFailure: He frowns at the wound. "Stubborn one." The treatment helps, but something lingers. "Come back in a few days. We'll see if it takes." Better than nothing. Barely.
options.tooltip: 70% base success. Starts recovery. Costs 100 gold.

options.resultText: You turn away. The surgeon says nothing — he's seen your type before. Proud fools who'd rather die than admit they need help. He'll be ready when you change your mind.

events.title: Rest and Recover
events.setup:
Your body aches for rest. Every step is an effort, every breath a reminder of what you're carrying. Sometimes the best medicine is time.

There's a spot by the supply wagons where nobody bothers you. Quiet. Out of the way.

options.text: Find a quiet corner and rest.
options.resultText: You settle against a wagon wheel and close your eyes. Hours pass. When you wake, the world feels less sharp, less hostile. The ache persists, but it's quieter now. Still there, just... waiting. Like everything else in this life.
options.tooltip: +10 HP. -1 Medical risk. Free but slow.

options.resultText: There's always something. Another duty, another demand. Rest is for peacetime, and you haven't seen peace in months. You push on.

events.title: Folk Remedy
events.setup:
An old woman follows the camp — no one knows her name, but everyone knows her remedies. Willow bark tea for fever. Yarrow poultice for wounds. Strange words muttered over the cup.

Some swear by her. Others cross themselves and walk away. Her prices are low, at least.

options.resultText: She presses a clay cup into your hands. The tea tastes like swamp water and despair. But by morning, the fever breaks. You feel almost human again. The old woman just nods when you thank her, like she expected nothing less.
options.resultTextFailure: The brew is bitter, the relief modest. She shrugs at your expression. "Sometimes it takes. Sometimes it doesn't." You're not sure if she's talking about the medicine or something else entirely.
options.tooltip: 50% base success. Partial healing. Cheaper than surgeon.

options.resultText: She doesn't seem offended. Just watches you leave with those knowing eyes. "You'll be back," she says, soft enough that you might have imagined it.

events.title: Urgent Medical Care
events.setup:
Your condition is worsening. The world blurs at the edges. Voices sound distant, muffled. You've seen men in this state before — some recovered. Some didn't.

The surgeon's tent is fifty paces away. It might as well be fifty miles.

options.resultText: Hands catch you as you stumble through the tent flap. The surgeon's face swims into focus, grim but determined. "Hold him down." What follows is a blur of pain and desperate work. When it's over, you're wrung out, emptied, but alive. "That was close," he says, washing the blood from his hands. "Don't let it get that bad again."
options.tooltip: Immediate treatment. +30 HP. Resets medical risk. Costs 200 gold.

options.resultText: You drag yourself to your bedroll and collapse. The night is long, fevered, full of strange dreams. But dawn finds you still breathing. The worst has passed — for now. They'll write songs about you, stubborn bastard that you are.
options.resultTextFailure: Your legs give out halfway to the tent. The ground is cold against your cheek. Voices shout, hands grab, and then darkness takes you. When you wake, you're worse than before. "Fool," the surgeon spits. He's not wrong.
options.tooltip: 40% to survive. Failure: -10 HP, condition worsens. Risky.

options.text: I need a moment to think.
options.resultText: You lean against a post and try to gather yourself. The world steadies, slightly. The surgeon watches from his tent, waiting. He knows you'll be back. They always come back — willing or otherwise.

events.title: Ship's Surgeon
events.setup:
The ship's surgeon works in a cramped space near the waterline, lit by a single lantern that swings with the waves. He's seen worse, he'll tell you — storms, scurvy, sea-battles. Your condition barely makes him blink.

His tools are sharp. His prices are fair. Out here, there's no one else.

options.resultText: He examines you by lantern-light, steady hands despite the ship's roll. "Bad, but not the worst I've seen." The needle bites, the rum burns going down, but when he's done, you feel better. "Stay out of the bilge. Clean air topside. You'll mend."
options.resultTextFailure: He works carefully, but the salt air and damp conditions fight him. "It'll take longer out here," he admits. "Keep it dry, stay topside. And pray for calm seas." Not the most reassuring prognosis.
options.tooltip: 70% base success. Starts recovery. Costs 100 gold.

options.resultText: The surgeon shrugs as you climb the ladder back to the main deck. He's seen your type before — soldiers who'd rather suffer than admit weakness. The sea doesn't care about pride, though. It takes whoever it wants.

events.title: Rest on Deck
events.setup:
Below decks the air is thick and stale, and you can feel it making you worse. But there's a spot near the bow where the sea spray comes fresh and the wind clears your head.

The sailors call it the "healing corner." Half-joke, half-truth.

options.text: Find a spot topside and breathe deep.
options.resultText: You wedge yourself into a corner near the mainmast and let the wind work. Salt air, endless horizon, the ship's steady rhythm. Hours pass. When you stir, the tightness in your chest has eased. The sea heals what it can, in its own time.
options.tooltip: +10 HP. -1 Medical risk. Sea air helps recovery.

options.text: No time. There's work to do.
options.resultText: Ropes need hauling, watches need keeping. The ship doesn't care if you're sick. You push on, each step an effort against both the rolling deck and your own body.

events.title: Sailor's Remedy
events.setup:
An old hand catches your arm. "You look rough, soldier. I've got something that helps." He produces a flask — rum mixed with lime juice, the sailor's cure-all. "Kept half the fleet alive through worse than this."

Officers don't approve. But officers aren't the ones dying of ship fever.

options.resultText: The grog burns going down, lime and rum and something that might be seawater. By morning you're steadier. The old sailor just nods when you thank him. "Works better than anything the surgeon's got. Don't tell him I said that."
options.resultTextFailure: The brew helps, but not as much as promised. Your head clears a bit, but the underlying sickness persists. "Sometimes it takes a second dose," the sailor suggests helpfully. Or a third. Or a real surgeon.
options.tooltip: 50% base success. Partial healing. Cheaper than surgeon. Sailors swear by it.

options.resultText: The sailor shrugs and takes a swig himself. "Suit yourself. Offer stands." He watches you walk away with the knowing look of someone who's been at sea longer than you've been alive.

events.title: Urgent Care at Sea
events.setup:
The deck pitches beneath you and your legs won't hold. Someone catches you before you hit the planking. Voices shout over the wind — "He's burning up!" "Get the surgeon!" "Make a hole!"

The ship's surgeon is your only hope now. And port is days away.

options.text: Let them carry me to the surgeon.
options.resultText: They lower you through the hatch on a rope sling. The surgeon's space is cramped, the lantern swings with each wave, but his hands are steady. What follows is a blur of pain and desperate work. When it's over, you're wrung out but breathing. "Another day of that and we'd be feeding you to the fish," he says. "Rest. That's an order."
options.tooltip: Immediate treatment. +30 HP. Resets medical risk. Costs 200 gold.

options.text: "Lash me to the mast. I'll ride it out."
options.resultText: They tie you to the mainmast with spare line, the way they do with sailors who've lost their minds. The night is endless fever-dreams of drowning, of voices calling from beneath the waves. But dawn finds you still alive. The sailors cross themselves when they cut you loose. You're not sure if that's respect or fear.
options.resultTextFailure: Your legs buckle, you slump against the ropes. Someone shouts. Then you're falling, or maybe the ship is falling, and nothing makes sense anymore. When you wake in the sick bay, you're worse than before. The surgeon just shakes his head. "Should have come to me sooner."
options.tooltip: 40% to survive. Failure: -10 HP, condition worsens. Dangerous at sea.

options.text: Give me a moment... need to catch my breath...
options.resultText: You brace yourself against the rail and try to focus. The horizon tilts and spins. Sailors watch from the rigging, waiting to see if you'll fall. The surgeon's mate hovers nearby, ready to catch you. Everyone knows what happens next. Everyone but you, apparently.
